intro: Pycnandra decandra subsp. decandra, commonly known as the yellow-eyed billygoat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a shrub characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
